title: Verb collection 3
sentences: el té verde al café por las mañanas.
I prefer green tea over coffee in the mornings.
que voy a llegar temprano mañana.
I promise you that I am going to arrive early tomorrow.
Be careful; that dog can bite if it is afraid.
Ten cuidado con la sopa, te puedes
Be careful with the soup; you can burn your tongue.
muy alto para alcanzar la comida.
The cat can jump very high to reach the food.
las velas de tu tarta de cumpleaños.
You have to blow out the candles on your birthday cake.
Sometimes I like to daydream (dream awake) about my vacations.
You always make me smile with your funny jokes.
a tus vecinos cuando los ves en el portal.
You must greet your neighbors when you see them in the doorway.
un buen libro para leer en verano?
Can you recommend a good book for me to read in the summer?
I can almost not recognize you with that new hat.
la oferta de trabajo porque estaba lejos.
She decided to reject the job offer because it was far away.
mucho con mis amigos el fin de semana.
I like to laugh a lot with my friends on the weekend.
tu habitación antes de salir de casa.
You have to pick up/tidy your room before leaving home.
I want to give you something special for your graduation.
este formulario con tus datos personales.
Please, fill out this form with your personal data.
We are going to distribute/divide the pizza among all of us.
We have to solve this problem as soon as possible.
en el parque a las cinco de la tarde.
We are going to meet/gather in the park at five in the afternoon.
mi bicicleta anoche en la calle.
Someone tried to steal my bicycle last night on the street.
Be careful not to break the glass cup.
la basura antes de irte a dormir?
Can you take out the trash before going to sleep?
la alfombra porque tiene mucho polvo.
We must shake the rug because it has a lot of dust.
al gato que estaba en el árbol.
The firefighter managed to save the cat that was in the tree.
Use a towel to dry your wet hands.
recto hasta llegar a la plaza central.
You have to continue straight until you reach the central square.
aquí a tu lado para hablar?
Can I sit here by your side to talk?
What does this strange word mean in Spanish?
I think we can solve this by talking calmly.
My alarm clock is going to ring very early tomorrow.
dictionary:
Preferir - To prefer
Prometer - To promise
Morder - To bite
Quemar - To burn
Saltar - To jump
Soplar - To blow
Soñar - To dream
Sonreír - To smile
Saludar - To greet
Recomendar - To recommend
Reconocer - To recognize
Rechazar - To reject
Reír - To laugh
Recoger - To pick up / tidy
Regalar - To give (a gift)
Rellenar - To fill out
Repartir - To distribute
Resolver - To solve
Reunir - To gather / meet
Robar - To steal
Romper - To break
Sacar - To take out
Sacudir - To shake
Salvar - To save
Secar - To dry
Seguir - To follow / continue
Sentar - To sit
Significar - To mean
Solucionar - To solve
Sonar - To ring / sound
